struct.name: net_driver_infiniband
struct.doc: Declare a fake driver to test the configuration system.

param.name: network_type
param.doc: Define a network's type (0=signalization, 1=data)

param.name: adm_port
param.doc: Defines the port number to use.

param.name: verbose_level
param.doc: Defines the verbose level of the Infiniband interface .

param.name: eager_limit
param.doc: Size of the eager buffers (short messages).

param.name: buffered_limit
param.doc: Max size for using the Buffered protocol (message split into several Eager messages).

param.name: qp_tx_depth
param.doc: Number of entries to allocate in the QP for sending messages. If too low, may cause an QP overrun

param.name: qp_rx_depth
param.doc: Number of entries to allocate in the QP for receiving messages. Must be 0 if using SRQ

param.name: cq_depth
param.doc: Number of entries to allocate in the CQ. If too low, may cause a CQ overrun

param.name: max_sg_sq
param.doc: Max pending RDMA operations for send

param.name: max_sg_rq
param.doc: Max pending RDMA operations for recv

param.name: max_inline
param.doc: Max size for inlining messages

param.name: rdma_resizing
param.doc: Defines if RDMA connections may be resized.

param.name: max_rdma_connections
param.doc: Number of RDMA buffers allocated for each neighbor

param.name: max_rdma_resizing
param.doc: Max number of RDMA buffers resizing allowed

param.name: init_ibufs
param.doc: Max number of Eager buffers to allocate during the initialization step

param.name: init_recv_ibufs
param.doc: Defines the number of receive buffers initially allocated. The number is on-the-fly expanded when needed (see init_recv_ibufs_chunk)

param.name: max_srq_ibufs_posted
param.doc: Max number of Eager buffers which can be posted to the SRQ. This number cannot be higher than the number fixed by the HW

param.name: max_srq_ibufs
param.doc: Max number of Eager buffers which can be used by the SRQ. This number is not fixed by the HW

param.name: srq_credit_limit
param.doc: Min number of free recv Eager buffers before posting a new buffer.

param.name: srq_credit_thread_limit
param.doc: Min number of free recv Eager buffers before the activation of the asynchronous thread. If this thread is activated too many times, the performance may be decreased.

param.name: size_ibufs_chunk
param.doc: Number of new buffers allocated when no more buffers are available.

param.name: init_mr
param.doc: Number of MMU entries allocated during the MPC initlization.

param.name: steal
param.doc: Defines if the steal in MPI is allowed

param.name: quiet_crash
param.doc: Defines if the Infiniband interface must crash quietly.

param.name: async_thread
param.doc: Defines if the asynchronous may be started at the MPC initialization.

param.name: wc_in_number
param.doc: Defines the number of entries for the CQ dedicated to received messages.

param.name: wc_out_number
param.doc: Defines the number of entries for the CQ dedicated to sent messages.

param.name: rdma_depth
param.doc: Number of outstanding RDMA reads and atomic operations on the destination QP (to be confirmed)

param.name: rdma_dest_depth
param.doc: Number of responder resources for handling incoming RDMA reads and atomic operations (to be confirmed)

param.name: low_memory
param.doc: Defines if the low memory mode should be activated

param.name: rdvz_protocol
param.doc: Defines the Rendezvous protocol to use (IBV_RDVZ_WRITE_PROTOCOL or IBV_RDVZ_READ_PROTOCOL)

param.name: rdma_min_size
param.doc: Defines the minimum size for the Eager RDMA buffers

param.name: rdma_max_size
param.doc: Defines the maximun size for the Eager RDMA buffers

param.name: rdma_min_nb
param.doc: Defines the minimum number of Eager RDMA buffers

param.name: rdma_max_nb
param.doc: Defines the maximum number of Eager RDMA buffers

param.name: rdma_resizing_min_size
param.doc: Defines the minimum size for the Eager RDMA buffers (resizing)

param.name: rdma_resizing_max_size
param.doc: Defines the maximum size for the Eager RDMA buffers (resizing)

param.name: rdma_resizing_min_nb
param.doc: Defines the minimum number of Eager RDMA buffers (resizing)

param.name: rdma_resizing_max_nb
param.doc: Defines the maximum number of Eager RDMA buffers (resizing)

param.name: size_recv_ibufs_chunk
param.doc: Defines the number of receive buffers allocated on the fly.

struct.doc: Global Parameters for IB common structs.

param.name: mmu_cache_enabled
param.doc: Defines if the MMU cache is enabled.

param.name: mmu_cache_entry_count
param.doc: Number of entries to keep in the cache.

param.name: mmu_cache_maximum_size
param.doc: Number of entries to keep in the cache.

struct.doc: Contain a list of driver configuration reused by rail definitions.

param.doc: Name of the driver configuration to be referenced in rail definitions.

param.name: driver
param.doc: Define the related driver to use and its configuration.

struct.name: gate_boolean
struct.doc: This gate applies given thruth value to messages.

param.name: value
param.doc: whereas to accept input messages or not

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: gate_probabilistic
struct.doc: This gate uses a given rail with a parametrized probability.

param.name: probability
param.doc: Probability to choose this rail in percents (ralatively to this single rail, integer)

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: gate_min_size
struct.doc: This gate uses a given rail if size is at least a given value.

param.name: value
param.doc: Minimum size to choose this rail (with units)

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: gate_max_size
struct.doc: This gate uses a given rail if size is at most a given value.

param.name: value
param.doc: Maximum size to choose this rail (with units)

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: gate_message_type
struct.doc: This gate can be used define which type of message can use a given rail.

param.name: process
param.doc: Process Specific Messages can use this rail

param.name: common
param.doc: Common messages (MPI) can use this rail

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: gate_user
struct.doc: This gate uses a given rail with a user defined function.

param.name: gatefunc
param.doc: Function to be called for this gate

struct.name: net_rail
struct.doc: Define a rail which is a name, a device associate to a driver and a routing topology.

param.name: name
param.doc: Define the name of current rail.

param.name: priority
param.doc: Number which defines the order in which routes are tested (higher first).

param.name: device
param.doc: Define the name of the device to use in this rail.

param.name: topology
param.doc: Define the network topology to apply on this rail.

param.name: ondemand
param.doc: Define if on-demand connections are allowed on this rail.

param.name: config
param.doc: Define the driver config to use for this rail.

array.name: gates
array.doc: List of gates to be applied in this config.

struct.name: net_cli_option

param.doc: Define the name of the option.

array.name: rails

struct.name: networks
struct.doc: Base structure to contain the network configuration

array.name: configs
array.doc: Define the configuration driver list to reuse in rail definitions.

array.name: rails
array.doc: List of rails to declare in MPC.

array.name: cli_options
array.doc: List of networks available through the '-net' argument of mpcrun.
